intro: Tithymalus lutescens, commonly known as the yellow tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in Mediterranean climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Tithymalus lutescens is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
